intro: Hedyotis halei, commonly known as the golden thread, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling threads, hence its common name. Hedyotis halei typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
